creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: small round box shaped like drum with studs around top and bottom edges
text: Made in the shape of  a drum, this small box was likely associated with the scholar's desk as a container for incense or small objects. There is a row of crisply carved bosses along the edge of the lid and the bottom of the container carved to resemble the metal bosses used on a drum to fasten the leather top and bottom to the wooden carcass.
title: Drum-shaped Box
